intro: Agarista serrulata, commonly known as the serrated agarista, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves with serrated edges. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers, followed by small, round fruits. Agarista serrulata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments.
